alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Clay; Quitman; Randolph (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 25 at 5:42PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Henry County in southeastern Alabama, Clay, western Randolph, northwestern Calhoun and southeastern Quitman Counties in southwestern Georgia through 630 PM EDT/530 PM CDT/... At 541 PM EDT/441 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Richards Crossroads, or 7 miles north of Abbeville, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Abbeville, Fort Gaines, Cuthbert, Bellville, Walter F. George Lock And Dam, Walter F George Lake, Standleys Store, Carnegie, Watson Crossroads, Scottsboro Crossroads, Double Bridges, Ricks Place, Pecan, Randolph Co A/p, Thomas Mill Creek, Morris, Jones Crossing, Bethel, Benevolence and Suttons Corner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
